big_picture_notes: 2 Thessalonians follows Paul’s epistolary formula: Salutation → Thanksgiving/Prayer (ch. 1) → Expositional correction on the Day of the Lord (ch. 2) → Paraenesis/exhortation and conclusion (ch. 3). The letter clarifies eschatological confusion by establishing a chronology (apostasy and the Man of Lawlessness precede the Parousia), encourages perseverance under persecution, and disciplines idleness. Literary glue: repetition of standing firm, affliction/justice, Parousia language, and Paul’s autograph as authentication (3:17) against forged reports (2:2).

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (1:1) standard salutation inaugurates the proem; end (1:12) completes the doxological prayer that frames suffering within God’s righteous judgment. Glue: affliction/persecution repeated, and justice/righteousness theme binding commendation (1:3–4) to judgment (1:5–10) and petition (1:11–12).

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Epistolary address and eucharistia; ends with boasting in steadfast endurance under persecutions. Devices: hyperbole (faith growing abundantly), parallel growth of faith/love.

‘This is evidence of God’s righteous judgment…’; concludes with the Lord’s revelatory coming to be glorified in his saints. Devices: antithesis (tribulation vs rest), apocalyptic imagery, parallel repayment.
‘To this end we always pray…’ ends with doxological purpose (‘that the name… be glorified’). Devices: inclusio on worthiness, glory motif, concise petition.

stories.story_title: The Lord’s Coming and the Man of Lawlessness
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (2:1) ‘Now concerning…’ introduces the corrective body; end (2:17) closes with benedictory encouragement to stand firm. Glue: Parousia terminology, Man/Mystery of Lawlessness anaphora, and chronological sequencing (apostasy → lawless one → the Lord’s defeat).

scenes.scene_name: Correcting False Prophecy on the Day of the Lord
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: ‘Now concerning… we ask you…’ not to be quickly shaken; ends ‘Do you not remember…?’ Devices: hortatory plea, peri‑de style transition, appeal to prior catechesis.

scenes.scene_name: Revelation of the Man of Lawlessness
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: What restrains revealed; lawless one slain by the Lord’s breath; ends with reason for judgment. Devices: mystery language (restrainer), narrative contrast, signs and lying wonders vs truth‑belief.

scenes.scene_name: Thanksgiving and Exhortation to Stand Firm
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Shift to gratitude for the beloved, called to glory; closes with prayer to comfort and establish. Devices: contrast ‘we/you’ vs ‘they’, election/calling lexicon, benedictory close.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (3:1) ‘Finally, brothers’ begins paraenesis and requests prayer; end (3:18) autograph and grace benediction. Glue: repeated ‘brothers,’ orderliness vs disorderliness (ataktōs), apostolic example/command linkage, and authentication (3:17).

scenes.scene_name: Request for Prayer and Mutual Confidence
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Pray for the word’s advance and deliverance; confidence in their obedience; prayer for directed hearts. Devices: double petition, confidence formula, wish‑prayer (optative).
In the Lord’s name, keep away from the idle; imitate apostolic work ethic; ‘if anyone will not work, neither let him eat.’ Devices: command formula, exemplar argument, aphorism rule.
Do not grow weary; note the disobedient; peace wish; autograph sign; grace with all. Devices: peroratio blend (discipline + peace), autograph inclusio, benediction formula.
